qas.question: Which disease did Arline succumb to?
In which year did his wife die?
Who played a cameo in a film about Feynman?
What was the name of the film that showed Feynman's life?
What year did Feynman's wife come back to life?
Who lost their role for a cameo in a film about Feynman?
What was the name of the TV show that showed Feynman's life?

context: While pursuing his PhD at Princeton, Feynman married his high school sweetheart, <a0_0><b5_0>Arline Greenbaum<b5_0/><a0_0/> (often misspelled "Arlene"), despite the knowledge that she was seriously ill with <a1_0><b6_0>tuberculosis<b6_0/><a1_0/>—an incurable disease at the time. She died in <a2_0><b7_0>1945<b7_0/><a2_0/>. In 1946, Feynman wrote a letter to her, expressing his deep love and heartbreak, that he kept for the rest of his life. ("Please excuse my not mailing this," the letter concluded, "but I don't know your new address.") This portion of Feynman's life was portrayed in the 1996 film <a4_0><b9_0>Infinity<b9_0/><a4_0/>, which featured <a3_0><b8_0>Feynman's daughter, Michelle<b8_0/><a3_0/>, in a cameo role.
